intro: Dicalix anomalus, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers well-drained soil and bright, indirect light. Its leaves are velvety and often have a striking coloration, while the flowers come in a variety of colors including purple, pink, and white. Dicalix anomalus is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
